title: Formation of British Indian Army
description: The British East India Company established its own military force, which later evolved into the British Indian Army, laying the foundation for organized armed forces in the subcontinent.

title: Carnatic Wars
description: Series of three Anglo-French wars fought in South India for control over trade routes and territories; significantly shaped European dominance and the future Indian military landscape.

title: Battle of Plassey
description: British forces led by Robert Clive defeated Siraj-ud-Daula, marking the start of British colonial rule and large-scale military operations in India.

title: Battle of Buxar
description: A decisive British victory over combined Mughal and Awadh forces, further solidifying East India Company military control.

title: Anglo-Mysore Wars
description: Series of four wars between the British and the Kingdom of Mysore, culminating in the death of Tipu Sultan and the rise of British military supremacy in southern India.

title: Anglo-Maratha Wars
description: Three military campaigns leading to the defeat of Maratha Confederacy and near-total control of India by the British.

title: First Anglo-Burmese War
description: The British Indian Army fought a major campaign in Burma, expanding colonial military operations into Southeast Asia.

title: First War of Independence / Sepoy Mutiny
description: Mass uprising by Indian soldiers against British rule, resulting in the reorganization of the military and the establishment of the British Crown's direct rule over India.

title: Battle of Saragarhi
description: 21 Sikh soldiers held off thousands of Afghan attackers, becoming an enduring symbol of bravery and sacrifice in Indian military history.

title: World War I
description: Over 1 million Indian soldiers served globally under the British, demonstrating international reach and significant wartime sacrifice with 74,000 deaths.

title: World War II
description: Indian Army emerged as the largest volunteer force, 2.5 million strong, fighting in Asia, Africa, and Europe; laid groundwork for post-independence military capability.

title: Partition & First Indo-Pakistani War
description: The Indian military engaged Pakistan over Jammu and Kashmir immediately after independence, shaping boundary outcomes and operational doctrines.

title: Operation Polo
description: Indian military operation to integrate the princely state of Hyderabad into the Union of India, asserting sovereignty and regional control.

title: Operation Vijay
description: Liberation of Goa, Daman, and Diu from Portuguese rule by a coordinated military campaign; marked the end of colonial enclaves.

title: Sino-Indian War
description: Brief but intense conflict with China over disputed Himalayan borders; revealed weaknesses and led to modernization efforts in the Indian military.

title: Second Indo-Pakistani War
description: Armed confrontation with Pakistan across multiple fronts, including claimed victories in Punjab; helped refine the army’s operational logistics.

title: Third Indo-Pakistani War / Bangladesh Liberation
description: Indian military intervention led to creation of Bangladesh after swiftly defeating Pakistani forces on both eastern and western fronts.

title: Operation Blue Star
description: Indian Army carried out a controversial operation to remove militants from the Golden Temple in Amritsar, impacting civil-military relations and national security policy.

title: Operation Meghdoot
description: Indian Army established control over the Siachen Glacier in the world's highest battlefield, fundamentally altering Himalayan defense strategy.

title: Operation Pawan
description: The Indian Peace Keeping Force (IPKF) intervened in Sri Lanka during the civil war, marking India's largest overseas counter-insurgency mission.

title: Kargil War / Operation Vijay
description: Indian Army repelled Pakistani intrusions in Kargil, Jammu & Kashmir, with tactical innovations in high-altitude warfare.

title: Operation Parakram
description: Massive troop mobilization to the India-Pakistan border following the December 2001 Parliament attack, demonstrating readiness for full-scale war.

title: Operation Sarp Vinash
description: Indian Army eliminated large-scale terror infrastructure in Jammu and Kashmir in one of its largest counter-insurgency operations.

title: Operation Black Tornado
description: Rapid National Security Guard and Army counter-terror operation during the Mumbai attacks, reshaping India's approach to urban anti-terror missions.

title: Myanmar Cross-Border Operation
description: Indian Army conducted cross-border strikes in Myanmar, targeting insurgent groups; demonstrated more assertive new doctrine for surgical actions.

title: Surgical Strikes
description: Indian Army carried out precise cross-LoC strikes in Pakistan-administered Kashmir in response to Uri terror attacks, signaling a new assertiveness.

title: Balakot Airstrike
description: Indian Air Force entered Pakistani airspace in retaliation for the Pulwama suicide bombing, marking a historic escalation to cross-border air operations.

title: Galwan Valley Clash
description: India-China military standoff in Ladakh led to casualties for the first time in decades, prompting troop mobilization and a new focus on mountain warfare.

title: Operation Devi Shakti
description: Indian forces evacuated citizens and allied nationals during the Afghanistan crisis, showcasing overseas operational capability.

title: Operation Ganga
description: Indian military and Air Force facilitated mass evacuations from Ukraine following the outbreak of the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Defence Modernization & Reforms
description: Major reforms included acquisition of Rafale jets, S-400 systems, indigenous missile upgrades (Agni, BrahMos), indigenous Tejas fighter jets, nuclear submarine INS Arihant, network-centric warfare, AI integration for intelligence, rising defense exports, and comprehensive border and cyber defense programs.

title: Major Joint Military Exercises
description: India held large-scale joint exercises with the US (Yudh Abhyas), Russia (Indra), Nepal (Surya Kiran), and others, demonstrating enhanced military interoperability and global partnership.

title: Operation Sindoor
description: Indian Army conducted unprecedented cross-border counter-terror strikes in Pakistan/PoK after the Pahalgam attack. 9 major terror sites destroyed, showcasing technological advances and an evolved doctrine in 21st century warfare.
